required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators goal is to determine the efficacy of school/classroom based environmental intervention in reducing asthma morbidity in urban schoolchildren.

detailed_description.textblock: Our proposal builds upon our established, successful school-based infrastructure to determine whether a school/classroom intervention will efficiently and effectively improve asthma morbidity by reducing these exposures. Our goal is to determine the efficacy of school/classroom based environmental intervention in reducing asthma morbidity in urban schoolchildren. Our central hypothesis is that reducing classroom/school exposure to mouse allergen, mold, and particulate pollutants will decrease asthma morbidity in students with asthma. The investigators plan to test this hypothesis in an intervention study of 300 elementary students with asthma from multiple classrooms in inner-city elementary schools. Our clinical trial aims are to determine the effectiveness of a school/classroom based environmental intervention (school integrated pest management and classroom air purifying filter units within these schools) to reduce asthma morbidity. Our mechanistic aim is to test the hypothesis that effects of school/classroom-based environmental interventions on symptoms/other measures of asthma control occur through changes in gene methylation or expression in pathways (and secondarily, in genes) relevant to airway function and asthma. This will expand our understanding of asthma immunopathogenesis and create opportunities to identify potential novel targets for asthma therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Number of Days With Asthma Symptoms Within 2 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Maximum number of Days with wheezing, tightness in the chest, or cough and/or Nights with disturbed sleep as a result of asthma and/or Days on which the child had to slow down or discontinue play activities because of asthma This is defined as a cumulative assessment from the different variables listed in the Measure Description

other_outcome.description: Spirometry measure of forced expiration volume in 1 second
Number of school days missed because of asthma/ 2 weeks

[a comprehensive severity scale of day symptoms and albuterol use, night symptoms and albuterol use, controller treatment, lung function measures, and exacerbations], health care utilization, and pulmonary function testing (PFT's) including FEV1; FEV1/FVC, FEF25-75. CASI ranges from 0 (lowest) -20 points (highest) with a minimal clinically important difference of 0.49 points. The higher score is worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Active Classroom air purifiers and school integrated pest management environmental intervention
Sham air purifiers and no school integrated pest management environmental intervention
Active air purifiers and no school integrated pest management environmental intervention
Sham air purifiers and active school integrated pest management

intervention.description: integrated pest management and environmental strategy
no integrated pest management and sham air purifier

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- grades K-8 with asthma attending sampling/intervention schools
Exclusion Criteria:
- moving schools

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
